questions.question_text:
A local community college uses Microsoft SharePoint Online to track and manage laptop computers that are issued to faculty and other employees.
Information about all laptops must be visible in Asset Management for Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. Users must be able to issue new laptop computers to faculty and other employees directly from the system.
You need to recommend a solution for the college.
Which two actions should you recommend? Each correct answer provides a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: B and C are correct.

Selected Answer: AC
Implement data management: This will allow the college to import and export data between SharePoint Online and Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management, ensuring that all laptop information is visible and up-to-date.

Embed PowerApps into the Employees form: By embedding PowerApps, users can create custom applications to issue new laptops directly from Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. This provides a seamless and user-friendly interface for managing laptop issuance.

D to satisfy "Users must be able to issue new laptop computers to faculty"
and C to satisfy "and other employees directly from the system"

comments.content: D is incorrect because the requirement is to issue laptops to faculty, not to register new laptops in the system (which they do in SharePoint). You can use Asset management without Fixed assets: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/supply-chain/asset-management/integration-to-fixed-assets/fixed-asset-integration
No actually BC seem right. You can use powerapps to connect the workers to the assets in sharepoint

discussion.content: I would take B and D here
